newsitem.title: BELGIUM: TWO TEENAGERS SAID MISSING IN BELGIUM.
newsitem.headline: TWO TEENAGERS SAID MISSING IN BELGIUM.

text.p: Two teenage girls have been reported missing in Belgium after failing to return home from a shopping trip in the town of Liege, Belga news agency said early on Saturday.

The agency said the girls, Rachel Legeard, 18, and Severine Potty, 19, had boarded a bus home on Thursday afternoon but apparently got off before their stop. There has been no word of them since, it said.
Gendarmes in Liege posted the two as missing late on Friday and have set up a coordination centre to work on the case, Belga said.
Belgium has been shaken by the uncovering of a paedophile ring linked to a number of missing children, two of whom were found dead.
